item.title: R to @gabrielmilland: In my (recent) experience, the function of the departmental press officer is to make you email a transcription of the question you just asked and then, once your deadline has passed, send you a copy-and-paste quote from .gov website.
item.dc:creator: @rafaelbehr
item.description: In my (recent) experience, the function of the departmental press officer is to make you email a transcription of the question you just asked and then, once your deadline has passed, send you a copy-and-paste quote from .gov website.

item.title: R to @MattChorley: A whole campaign grid themed around disco anthems about ditching wrong'un men - Enough is Enough; I Will Survive; Young Hearts Run Free ...
item.dc:creator: @rafaelbehr
item.description: A whole campaign grid themed around disco anthems about ditching wrong'un men - Enough is Enough; I Will Survive; Young Hearts Run Free ...

item.title:
RT by @rafaelbehr: Memo to Labour:
Adopt Rayner's "enough is enough" as a slogan.
Adopt "Enough is Enough" by Donna Summer as an election anthem.
Victory guaranteed. #banger
item.dc:creator: @MattChorley
item.description:
Memo to Labour:

Adopt Rayner's "enough is enough" as a slogan.

Adopt "Enough is Enough" by Donna Summer as an election anthem.

Victory guaranteed. #banger

item.title: R to @imran_1: Bit squirmy, if you ask me. (Which, I concede, you didn't.)
item.dc:creator: @rafaelbehr
item.description: Bit squirmy, if you ask me. (Which, I concede, you didn't.)

item.title: RT by @rafaelbehr: The world economy runs on oil and that means a functioning world economy requires political stability in enough oil-producing countries, a condition which since the early 2000s has been more often than not absent.
item.dc:creator: @HelenHet20
item.description:
The world economy runs on oil and that means a functioning world economy requires political stability in enough oil-producing countries, a condition which since the early 2000s has been more often than not absent.

item.description: Column, on Johnson Time, teal voters and the appeal of 'make politics boring again' theguardian.com/commentisfre…

item.title: R to @steve151999: Thank you. I was thinking about exactly this the other day; how there used to be squeamishness (in print) about calling politicians liars - euphemisms were preferred - but with him it's just the most efficient word to get to the undeniable fact.
item.dc:creator: @rafaelbehr
item.description: Thank you. I was thinking about exactly this the other day; how there used to be squeamishness (in print) about calling politicians liars - euphemisms were preferred - but with him it's just the most efficient word to get to the undeniable fact.

item.title:
RT by @rafaelbehr: The difference scale of finance in US politics is always eye-opening. $50m donation to a candidate for Illinois Governor who won't win.
Here £1m or so will get you a seat in the Lords and regular chats with the PM. https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/21-republican-primaries-and-a-special-election-to-watch-on-june-28/
item.dc:creator: @Samfr
item.description:
The difference scale of finance in US politics is always eye-opening. $50m donation to a candidate for Illinois Governor who won't win.

Here £1m or so will get you a seat in the Lords and regular chats with the PM.
fivethirtyeight.com/features…

item.title: RT by @rafaelbehr: As the Northern Ireland bill enters a second reading in the House of Commons, a couple of observations on the current situation over the Protocol following a visit in Brussels last week. A short thread:
item.dc:creator: @AntonSpisak
item.description: As the Northern Ireland bill enters a second reading in the House of Commons, a couple of observations on the current situation over the Protocol following a visit in Brussels last week. A short thread:

item.title: R to @Samfr: Wasn't this a legacy of the high concept of UC - that it replicates the pattern of salaried work, so part of transition from idleness to honest toil. Hence monthly, in arrears.
item.dc:creator: @rafaelbehr
item.description: Wasn't this a legacy of the high concept of UC - that it replicates the pattern of salaried work, so part of transition from idleness to honest toil. Hence monthly, in arrears.

item.title: R to @alxbear: 6k majority in South Swindon. With tactical voting could easily see that going. Probably be grateful for a peerage one day. But maybe he has gone the full Way of Frost.
item.dc:creator: @rafaelbehr
item.description: 6k majority in South Swindon. With tactical voting could easily see that going. Probably be grateful for a peerage one day. But maybe he has gone the full Way of Frost.

item.title: I misjudged Buckland (remainer who backed Johnson in 2019.) I thought he was a useful idiot who convinced himself he cld have influence on the inside because he fancied a job in cabinet. Turns out he actually believes this stuff even after Johnson used him and spat him out.
item.dc:creator: @rafaelbehr
item.description:
I misjudged Buckland (remainer who backed Johnson in 2019.) I thought he was a useful idiot who convinced himself he cld have influence on the inside because he fancied a job in cabinet. Turns out he actually believes this stuff even after Johnson used him and spat him out.
